This document provides examples of how to use the `Person` R6 class defined in `person.R`.

Load the `person.R` script to access the `Person` class.
```{r setup, include=TRUE}
source('person.R')
```

Create a new `Person` object and display its details using an implied call to the `$print` method.
```{r example-usage}
john <- Person$new("John Doe", age=30)
john
```

Note that the type of the `age` parameter is protected.
```{r example-type-protection, error=TRUE}
jane <- Person$new("Jane Doe", age="thirty")
```

Perform introspection on the `Person` instance to see its methods and fields.
```{r example-introspection}
class(john)
names(john)
```
